greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let n = 10*x + y where 0 <= y <= 9, x >= 0. Then a(n) = 6*x + y.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
formula: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-10) - a(n-11) for n > 10. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Apr 25 2017
maple: A081597:=n->n-4*floor(n/10): seq(A081597(n), n=0..150); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 25 2017
program: (PARI) my(n, x, y); vector(200, n, y=(n-1)%10; x=(n-1-y)\10; 6*x+y) \\ _Colin Barker_, Jun 24 2014
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 22 2003
